prompt:
Nurse: Alright, Mr. Kageyama. If you have any questions later, don't hesitate to ask. Examples of clear liquids include water, green tea, clear broth, light colored sports drinks, and jello or other gelatin without fruit or red color. Do you have any remaining questions about the diet changes?

Patient: No.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. Kageyama. If you have any questions later, don't hesitate to ask. The other main step to remember is drinking the laxative solution the night before your procedure. You'll need to start drinking the first half of your GoLYTELY laxative solution around 6PM. And then wake up early the morning of the procedure to finish drinking the second half of the solution. Would you like some tips on making the bowel prep easier?

Patient: No. Thanks.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. Kageyama. If you have any questions later, don't hesitate to ask. Some people find it helpful to drink the laxative solution cold or through a straw to make it easier to consume. Do you have any questions about the bowel prep?

Patient: No.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. Kageyama. If you have any questions later, don't hesitate to ask. Some people don't have any problems and are able to drink all the bowel prep just fine. Now, let's move on to the next part of your prep which is when to stop eating and drinking everything before your procedure. You will need to finish your laxative solution and stop everything 4 hours before your procedure. Do you have any questions about this?

Patient: No.

responses.gpt4: Alright, Mr. Kageyama. If you have any questions later, don't hesitate to ask. Now, I've covered a lot of information, and I only have a few more questions left for you. But first, do you have any questions about what we've discussed so far?
responses.our_model: Alright, Mr. Kageyama. If you have any questions later, don't hesitate to ask. It's critical to follow these instructions to ensure the best results from your colonoscopy. Now, I've shared a lot of information with you but we're almost done. I have just 2 more questions for you. Before we proceed, do you have any questions?
